intro: Adenostemma swartzii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a red or purple calyx. It is adapted to arid environments and has a shallow root system that allows it to thrive in sandy soils. Adenostemma swartzii is also known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus.
